Need a quick & easy way to make your shag look more ✨fancy✨ this holiday season? This is my favorite way to style a shag for parties or formal events!

First we cleansed @julesxnelson with New Wash Orignal so she could air dry with some wave & texture. Then I applied Powder at her roots for lift & hold. Backcomb the roots around the crown for some added height. Then take your comb and pull hair to the back of the head to pin with bobby pins. I cross 2 bobby pins so it looks like a big X. That will keep your hair staying secure! Next use Wax to piece out and define all those adorable face framing tendrils. 

You can try these products through the link in my bio! If it’s your first time shopping @hairstorystudio you’ll get $10 off any order over $55! 🧡

8 years ago me & Graham went on our first date after swiping right on Tinder 🤣🙏😍 Crazy enough - I heard his name for the first time 16 years ago on my first day of hair school. When I was 18 I would lurk his MySpace & always thought he was such a cutie 🥰 We ran in similar Atlanta circles and were at the same parties/events many times, but never had actually met until that first date. 💞

Does anyone else feel WAY more connected to their dating anniversary than their wedding date?! This time of year makes me so nostalgic and always brings back a rush of emotions. I remember every single detail of our first winter together so vividly - it was such an exciting time to be falling deeply in love. 🥹

Happy dating anniversary to my lovey bug! I truly wish everyone on this planet gets to experience a love like ours. We are the very best of friends and I’m so damn grateful to have found him. 💕💕💕

Grateful beyond words for every single one of you who has sat in my chair this year 🫶 I appreciate all of the love, support, selfies, and messages where y’all let me know how much you love your hair 🥰🥰🥰 Wishing everyone a happy holiday weekend! Stay warm out there! ❤️‍🔥❤️‍🔥❤️‍🔥

One thing I always say & stand by - my clients’ hair always looks BEST when styled 100% by themselves (most often air dried too)! The thing that rules about low maintenance hair is that it truly looks amazing when nothing at all has been done to it! When my clients are in my chair at the salon I tell them I’m glad they like the look right now, but I think it will look even better once they do their first wash & airdry at home. 

Here are some of my favorite examples of my clients’ self styled hair from this year. There’s something so powerful about never having to worry that my clients “won’t be able to make it look like this at home.”

Yes, you will. AND it’ll look better than when I do it 💞💞💞💞

🔥 HOT TIP 🔥 Perfectly in place, smooth hair doesn’t translate well in your after photos or video. 

Next time you take photos of your work, try roughing the hair up a little bit more. I intentionally want hair to be a little out of place & messy because this creates texture & dimension in the photo. It makes the shot much more interesting to look at. In my classes, I tell people you almost want the hair to look a little ridiculous in person because THAT will translate better through a camera lens. 

I don’t know how else to describe it other than I pinch the hair, pick it up, & smoosh it around in my fingers to create some lift. 💞

I’m here to show you how I style my fine hair in a healthy way to enhance volume as a #nutrafolpartner!

I love doing this instead of a full blowout with the curling iron. It keeps breakage away from my already fragile hair, and takes a lot less effort. Also, when my hair is blown out straight it ends up looking much more flat to my head.

Have you ever tried diffusing your hair? Let us know by leaving an emoji in the comments below 👇

Raelin wanted something full and fluffy 😍 Dreams can come trueeee with French layering + @cultandking Jelly + @hairstorystudio Undressed & Powder. NO HOT TOOLS! NO ROUND BRUSHES! Just your natural texture doin it’s thang ✨

Jelly helps amp up your curl pattern while Undressed builds grip & volume. I diffused while twisting her hair to bring out the curl then fluffed out her waves once 100% dry & adding in Powder. I apply Powder roots to ends and then emulsify it into the hair.

Every winter my clients show up in my chair frustrated with their beloved textured suddenly not cooperating how they’re used to. 

No need to stress y’all - it’s totally normal! Cooler temperatures & much drier air can mean that your waves or curls are going to require a little more of a push to pop out. 

Here’s some of my tips if your curls are falling flat this winter:

❄️ Trim your length & layers a little shorter than usual. This will lighten your hair up & can enhance texture. If you haven’t had a cut in 6 months that’s a big reason why your texture feels lackluster. 

❄️ switch up your products. My frizzy, fluffy summer hair needs a very different product routine depending on the season. I like creamy, rich @hairstorystudio Hair Balm in the summer. During winter I need something way less heavy & more curl enhancing (aka more HOLD) so I use Jelly from @cultandking. (Links in bio to shop)

❄️ cut back on using heavy oils and leave in conditioner. So many people use these products & really don’t need them ever, but definitely not in the winter. They’re weighing your texture down. Try without!

❄️ getting curl in the winter may mean just putting in a little more effort than in the warmer months. Try scrunching longer or twisting your hair while it’s wet to provide more definition. 

❄️ as your hair is airdrying, continually mist water back into the hair. Or wet your hands and scrunch that water into your hair even once almost dry. This has the same effect as humidity being in the air. Water is your curls’ best friend. 

❄️ try diffusing! I love a silicone diffuser & utilizing the hovering method to bring out curl. Click on the ‘shop my favorite things’ link in my bio to try one. They’re less than $20!

❄️ try New Wash Original from @hairstorystudio to cleanse your hair. My hair has gone from being straight, poofy, & frizzy to having actual ringlets! 

❄️ when all else fails, cut yourself some slack! Throw a beanie on & call it a day! Spring is coming & with that - your curls will be back too 😘

The plans for the largest police facility in America are on 381 acres of Southeast Atlanta forest. I lived minutes from there for a handful of years in my twenties & can’t fathom what they are planning. 

Further militarizing police will worsen police brutality and surveillance. Almost 1,200 people were murdered by police in 2022 alone, and one forest defender has been murdered by police as well (✨rest in power Tortuguita). We do not want a growing police state, we want abolishment. This system is not working.

RESIST the urge to flip all the way upside down when diffusing your curls! Especially if you have a fringe or curtain bangs! 🌀 

From my experience, leaning forward 45 degrees is the perfect angle to heat your face framing bits up from every angle without burning your forehead 🥵 

It’ll help create lift & volume while getting your layers to really hug your facial features 😍

Flipping upside down (especially when there’s bangs involved) can create an awkward shape & force the bangs to lay in a direction that doesn’t feel natural 🙅‍♀️

And as always, there’s 10,000 ways to approach working with curly hair. This is simply my method for what works for the majority of my clients. There are specific haircuts that do look awesome flipped upside down, but they are typically veryyy voluminous rounded cuts.

Seriously wonder who started this hair myth 🤔🤔🤔 I started doing hair 16 years ago and for MANY of those years I was told that if you diffuse the clients’ hair all the way dry, it’ll get frizzy. I’ve heard it repeated in many salons & classes I’ve taught. 

It’s false. 

Diffuse the hair to 110% - THAT’S what I teach anyone in a class with me. 

I have no idea where the hair myth originated, but frizz tends to show up when hair is about 60-70% dry. Push past that. Don’t give up. Trust the process. Add water 💦 if you need to, not more product. 

Even when you feel discouraged about how the hair is looking, keep diffusing until completely dry. Now you can actually refine your cut (SO important), add products for dry hair like powder or spray, and your client gets to not leave the salon with half damp hair! WIN - WIN 🏅 🏆 

Try it out next time & let me know what you think! 🫶🦋

blunt yet soft ✨

HAIRCUT ADJUSTMENTS?! 👀 😱 this one is for the people pleasers of the world 🫶 I’m letting y’all know now - this is NOT something that is ever going to offend me! Like…not even a tiny bit. 💞

Whether it’s during your appointment or week later, I actually really WANT you to let me know if something is feeling off. 

Hairstylists are human beings not robots. We have off days just like anyone else. Also hair reacts differently once settled back into your at home routine. Please help me help YOU love your hair! ✨

NOW while we are on the subject there are complimentary adjustments & then there are some things that you should be booking as a brand new service! ✂️

Things that are typical adjustment requests:

Something uneven
Top layer is too thick
Bottom layers are too thick
A piece is sticking out funny

Things that should be booked as a new service:

You asked for no bangs, but now you want bangs
You asked for a specific length, but now you’d like another 3+ inches off
You asked for ____ haircut, but now you’d like to try a completely different hairstyle because you don’t like it

Can curly hair “get angry” after being cut? 😱

YES! Absolutely! 👀

Main factors:

✂️ being combed through repeatedly 

🌀 using completely different water, shampoo, & products than what you have home

☀️ being heat up with a diffuser if you typically airdry 

all of that to say, there is no one size fits all for ANY hair type, but especially when it comes to curly hair! ✨

some people leave the salon with their curls completely unaffected while other folks may take 2 weeks or more for their texture to settle back into place. just give it time! ⏰ 

go easy on yourself and give yourself some grace if that happens! 🫶💞

and just remember, it never hurts to check in with your stylist and let them know you’re still waiting for everything to settle before deciding if something should go shorter!

On average I see most of my clients twice a year for full haircuts! Outside of that, we may do a bang trim or a 30 minute dry refresh session to touch up face framing or layers. My haircuts are very intentionally built to LAST, yall.

So next time you’re in my chair, there’s no need to apologize for 9 months passing - that’s 👏 what 👏 I 👏 expected 💞

I CANNOT stress this one enough 💦 Moisture is your best friend! Quit adding on more product, and instead add water!

I diffuse ALL of my clients who tell me that they airdry at home! I do this because I want to see their haircut closest to how it’s going to behave for them when they style it themselves. 

With straight, swavy, and wavy hair textures - the diffuser can actually still blow away a lot of their natural texture. 

One way I kick up the curl pattern, is by lightly misting more water back into the hair as I diffuse. This same technique works when airdrying. The goal isn’t to soak the hair wet, but to just gently mist water back in. 

It creates a similar effect to “beach hair” or rainy day hair - your hair is curlier on those days because there is WATER in the air! 💧

✂️ BANGS ✂️ for all hair types and all hair textures ALL the time 🫶 if anyone has ever told you that “you can’t have bangs because _______” I would like to politely disagree.

I absolutely love problem solving ways to make certain styles work for my clients. It can take thinking outside of the box and figuring how to adjust a style to custom fit a person’s needs. But with a little creativity, anything is possible. 

I’ve been doing hair for almost 17 years and I’ve still yet to meet a client who “can’t have bangs.” I will 100% document end if it happens! 🩵🦋🩵

Curly hair can be unpredictable, finicky, and extremely fragile - go easy on yourself with your hair journey! ✨🫶

Whether you airdry or diffuse, your results may vary from day to day. That’s okay! It’s part of the fun of having textured hair! Reframe the narrative and you’ll start to appreciate the spontaneity of how your hair chooses to exist each day. 💞

Y’all my heart DROPPED earlier this week when a client sent me a Tik Tok link with a text that said “OMG have you seen this?!” 😧😮🤢

Thankfully the haircut i did was just the inspiration for the influencer’s big chop. They credited me and had some sweet things to say, but I knew what was most likely coming next. 👀 

It seems like these type “here’s what I wanted and here’s what I got” TikTok’s are gaining popularity, and my heart breaks for any stylist that becomes the butt of the joke. We all put our heart & soul into what we do. Sometimes we miss, but sometimes clients just need to give it a few days! ✂️

If you go in for a new haircut and are feeling less than thrilled, I encourage you to wash and style your hair yourself. Play around with it. Sleep on it. Try airdrying or diffusing! Try different products. It’s completely NORMAL for hair to freak out after going through a big change. It’s also normal for it to take a minute for you to “figure out” how to style it to your preferences. 🦋

There are SO many styling tutorials all over Instagram and TikTok! Watch a few and try not to get too frustrated about a new cut right off the bat! I’ve even had hairstylists tell me that it took them a minute to figure out a new look - and we do this everyday for a living! 🫶

I was so so so happy to see this saga play out & for Lou to ultimately LOVE the cut they received! Further proving that sometimes a nightmare can work out just fine yall! 🥳🥳🥳

For anyone interested the original poster is @ loudang on tiktok. The series of original videos about the haircut are set to friends only so you’d need to follow them to see those (the follow up ‘I actually love the cut’ video is public tho!)

I have fine, wavy hair. Some days it’s curlier, some days it’s a loose wave. It takes about one hour for my hair to push past what I call “the fragile stage.” This stage is when hair is 30 - 80% damp.  It’s not soaking wet, but it’s not quite dry either. 🚨 SHE’S VERY TEMPERAMENTAL IN THIS STAGE. I GOTTA BE GENTLE!🚨 

I can’t do the things listed in this reel (if i want my hair to look good) because it will cause my curls to get blown around or smooshed down flat. 🙅‍♀️ Both of these things mean frizz, fluff, and no curl definition for me. 

I typically rewet my hair in the morning and while I air dry I’m eating breakfast, putting on makeup, getting dressed, then driving to work. All LOWWWW impact activities while my hair is in her stressed out era. 🤫

Once my hair reaches about 80% dry, I can start to move around more without worrying about the shape looking a mess. 🙌

Think of it like this 💡 Once your curls or waves are DRY the shape is SET into the hair. Now I can headbang, flip it around, and get my hands in there to fluff out more volume - but only once dry! 🌵 And not a moment before! 🌀

Just a lil “Olivia’s curls” appreciation post 🥰🥰🥰 Being trusted by folks who have textured hair is seriously such an honor & brings me so much joy 🥲

🔑 Communication is the key!!! I talk about this so much in every type of class I teach! It does not feel good to be in the dark about what’s going on! When your clients feel at ease they can really relax and start to build trust with you as their stylist 🤝

✨ I remember years ago, without even realizing this is something I was doing, my clients would thank me for explaining each step of the service. Whether it was a haircut or color, I always let them know what I was doing, why, and what to expect next. Imagine it’s your first appointment with someone and you’re just left sitting in a shampoo bowl, alone, not knowing what’s actually going on. It’s not a great feeling! 😰

✂️ These days I only do haircuts, but still a new client may not know - am I going to wash their hair? Is it a dry cut? Wet cut? Are we done with the cut when it’s wet or will there be time at the end to speak up about adjustments? I don’t want them to sit their and have to wonder about any of that so I explain it all during my consultation. 

🦋 I have an online class on The Art of the Consultation where I do deep dive into the psychology behind my haircut consults. In this virtual class, I go over exactly how I make my clients feel at ease & what questions I ask to nail their experience.

Came across these haircut photos from about 4 years ago 🥲 Around that time is when I remember haircutting becoming really, really fucking inspiring to me. 5 years ago I left behind a full clientele after 10 years of doing hair at the same salon in Atlanta. I loved my clients there dearly, but was feeling bored. Stagnant. It was a huge risk to leave it all behind to start over somewhere where I knew maybe 2 people tops. Little did I know, that that move would be everything I needed and more. My first week doing hair in Asheville I was amazed at how every single person that sat in my chair was an artist, a musician, a performer, an entrepreneur, a maker. They inspired me and truly trusted me to just do whatever I felt was best. It was beautiful and invigorating and set my career on FIRE because I felt free behind the chair for the first time in a very long time. 

Anytime I see hair photos from that first year or two, it always brings back that wave of emotion. 🥲

Writing this today for whoever needs to hear it. Make the move. Start over. Go to hair school. Become a cutting specialist. Rebrand yourself. Change salons. Go out on your own. Open the salon. Film the tutorial and post it. Book the class. 

Do whatever the fuck you’ve been keeping yourself small out of fear for. 

I’m the most risk adverse person you’ll ever meet, but I’m here to say the risk really is worth the reward 🫶

🫶🫶 just showing up as yourself is all ya need to do! 💞✂️

Are you constantly trying to get more curl out of your wavy hair? Do you consider yourself to be “not that curly but not that straight?” SAVE THIS POST! ⚠️⚠️⚠️

One of the most common textures I have in my chair is what we call “swavy” 🌀 You have hair that depending on the day, the routine, the humidity, and countless other factors - can present straight or wavy and on a few miracle moments full blown CURLY!

There’s a reason why your hair looks it’s best at the beach or after you get kiiiiinda stuck in a rainstorm. ☔️ All that added moisture in the air is creating curl in your hair. 

You can replicate this effect at home by simply adding water to your hair even after it’s mostly dried. I spray down my hair in the morning with a water bottle then add my products. Once my hair starts hitting 80% dry I start scrunching my wet hands back into the hair. I typically repeat 2-3 times a day in the morning/early afternoon. 💦 

To keep it simple, I tell my clients that anytime they wash their hands in the morning - just add that water directly into your hair to dry them off. 

It may sound bizarre but trust me it works!

❤️‍🔥💅

2021 was the first year I entered, and I was SHOOK when I received two nominations. 🤯 You always hear that award shows are rigged or you gotta know somebody to even get noticed. Well I can tell you firsthand, that I didn’t *know* ANYONE. I didn’t have that big of a following on here at that time. I didn’t work at some big name hair salon, or know any big wigs in the industry. So yes - you CAN get nominated without a big city hair entourage 🤣🙌

Each year since, it’s propelled me to be a better hairstylist. I kept pushing myself to take more classes and get out of my comfort zone. So THANK YOU @behindthechair_com @marybehindthechair & @kevin.givens for keeping me inspired to step out of the box! 🫶✨

My oldest dog is severely handicapped & needs me home so I’m gonna need ALL my hair besties to take pictures with my haircut shots on the nominee wall (and tag me!!!)! 💞💞💞 I love y’all & congrats to all my homies that were nominated this year! 🥳🥳🥳

🥹🫶🥹 To the people who told me not going to college was a terrible idea. 

To the people who said doing hair wasn’t a real career. 

To the people who said I need an art degree to ‘fall back on.’

To the teachers at hair school who treated me like i wouldn’t make it. 

To the salon owner who sat me down and said that she didn’t think I actually wanted to do hair. 

Actions speak louder than words, and this entire time I knew I was going to do the damn thing. 💖💖💖

To anyone out there starting their career or planning on going to hair school - just know that there will be naysayers. Know that cosmetology is like a dang battlefield & sometimes the educators are your biggest bullies. Know that there will be other young stylists that want to talk shit and knock you down a peg. 💪

But my biggest advice to stylists starting out is focus on YOU and only YOU. Your path is your path, and what other people are doing/not doing doesn’t concern you. I’m proud of you & I believe in you! 💞

🤔 🤔 🤔 interestingggggg! I saw this wavy hack online & had to try it out! It had so much potential, but ended up as a flop for me! BUT! The point i want to get across for folx who air dry is PLAY AROUND! 💓

There is NO one size fits all for textured hair or air dry routines! 🌀 You gotta try different things and know that some will be a hit and some will be a miss! But you’ll learn a lot about your hair in the process! 💡 

Use days where you’re just going to be at home to play with different techniques or products. Worst case scenario - you can rewet your hair & start again! 💦 Hair doesn’t have to be so serious!

Does anyone out there do this and have good results with it? I’m guessing people who have a curlier hair pattern at the root might actually be able to make this work! 👩‍🦱 My hair is super straight at the roots so it shows bends really easily!

Ondine (they/them) came to me this week & said they’ve always struggled with a massive cowlick on their hairline yet tons of dense fine hair that they weren’t sure what to do with either. 

They’d had hairstylists attempt bangs but they always ended up not quite right or took a lot of time to blowdry to cooperate. 

As I cut the shape, their hair began to fully airdry without any styling or products being used. Watching their eyes light up in disbelief is one of my absolute FAVORITE feelings as a hairstylist. 🥰🥰🥰

Sometimes it just takes the right haircut and the right techniques to truly achieve low maintenance, wash & go hair. I’ve always said, it’s 80% about the cut. Products can help assist or boost the look, but the haircut will always be the foundation. 

Thank you Ondine for the trust 🫶 If you’re out there reading this, I hope you know that I’ll remember this haircut for many years to come 🥲

PICTURES & A LIST?! 😱😱😱 Ummm YES PLEASE! 😍🙌

I genuinely LOVE when a new client has done their homework and shows up to their haircut session with me prepared! 🥰 Maybe you have an exact photo of what you want or a handful of different look possibilities. This helps me get an idea for what type of look you’re going for! 

💡✨ Another thing that is super beneficial - seeing looks you DON’T love! Whether it’s haircuts on you that you’ve had or cute looks online that just ain’t your vibe - this can help me narrow down what to rule out for you (especially if you don’t know exactly) 

✂️ I don’t necessarily need new clients to come to their appointment with their hair styled how they wear it. Feel free to rock a messy bun if you want, just bring me photos or videos of what your hair looks like on its best day + an average day. 

I’m a list making maniac 📝 so if you have some key points you want to go over before your haircut, I’m all ears! Don’t feel embarrassed, this is actually really helpful for me 🥲

🫶 And while it’s totally okay to come to your appointment with no photo references or ideas, I’m most likely going to pull some looks to show you on my phone. I’m super visual, and I also know nothing about you or your style so it helps to have something to build off of! 🦋

Right now it just doesn’t feel right to post anything other than what’s going on. Last night we had to rush Porkie to the emergency vet when he started screaming in pain and was unable to walk or move his back legs 😞💔 We spent 4 hours there while he got x rays and blood work done, and we waited for results. 

We don’t have a ton of answers yet, and he had to stay the night there to manage the severe pain he was in. We are transporting him to a neurological specialist today to have an MRI done & will most likely need surgery on his spine. 

Please send all positive thoughts and energy to our baby boy 🦛🩵🦛 If you know me & my husband, you know our dogs mean the entire world to us. 

It’s been 1 year and 4 months since Pork Roll had his stomach obstruction surgery, and 1 year since we found out Dime had DM. I honestly can’t handle any more grief, pain, or suffering 😓

Please universe do us a solid and let our baby make it out of this okay 🥺

Thank you thank you thank you everyone for your incredible love and well wishes. My Porkie baby is alive and that’s all that matters right now. I haven’t felt so all consumed by something like this in a very, very long time. But your messages and comments and texts meant the world to me & my family 🕯️ 🦛 🕯️ 🕊️ 🤍🤍🤍🤍🫂

I’m trying to just keep my head above water and take each day by day right now. Porkie will remain at the hospital until at least Tuesday. He’s eating and sleeping well. His severe pain is gone. You can follow along on @porkandpals for updates 🦛🦛🦛 He still doesn’t have movement in his legs, but with dogs that have stage 5 IVDD it is not uncommon to take days, weeks, or months for them to regain mobility. We will do it all - PT, laser therapy, water treadmills, acupuncture, whatever it takes for my prince. 🫶🐾✨ he’s a fighter and so are we. 

Last night the reality set in that he will be confined to a crate for 23 hours a day for the next 6-8 weeks. 😓 It is daunting and scary and with a rambunctious bully breed who needs ALOT of activity, I’m not sure exactly how we will do it. But I’m trying to remember that I’ve been through worse and made it to the other side 🤍🕊️🐾✨

I love you all so much. Your love for Porkie brings us alot of joy, and we love sharing him with the world. 🫂💞

And also while we’re at it I will be working VERY limited hours for the entire month of October while he’s in recovery. Please go ahead and book for November if you need a haircut, it is already filling up fast. ✂️✂️✂️

Return clients - I won’t have as much time to stay late for 30 minute sessions so I would encourage you to go ahead and book a 60 min dry cut if you think you may be in need 🫶 

🌙 And as always, to new or return clients - if you’re unable to book with me please book with one of the talented stylists at @neonmoonsalon! They have each been handpicked by me & are so talented. Email me if you need a recommendation ✨

✨🫶 “Do you diffuse all hair types?” YUP 🫡 If my client air dries their hair, then I’m going to diffuse it! 

I’m a perfectionist who is an insane FREAK about details 🙃 Because of that, I want to see my clients’ haircuts in their most true form. 🔑 

✂️ Almost any haircut can appear well done when styled by a professional using top of the line products, brushes, and hot tools. 

💞 I LOVE that for people that enjoy a salon quality blowout, but I’m wanting to see my work under a magnifying lens. I choose to diffuse *most* of my clients so I can refine the cut and make adjustments based off of what I see. 👀 

One of my favorite things to hear my clients say while I’m diffusing their hair is “omg this makes me trust that I can replicate this at home” 🥹😭🥹😭🥹

🔸 My approach to diffusing hair is extremely user friendly, and is meant to replicate how their hair will naturally airdry.

✂️🔑 With highly layered haircuts getting more and more popular, I think it’s important to remember that folx like Brittany can pull off this many layers at waist length because she has super HIGH density. (High density means that she has ALOT of hair on her head)

💡 You can have HIGH density hair that’s thick, but you can also have silky, fine hair that’s high density too. Either way, these hair types are great candidates for a super longggg layered cut 🙌 It gets tougher to do on anyone with low density because there’s simply less hair to work with. 

What a GIFT it was to get to cut this beautiful head of hair! 😍😍 Thank you for the trust Brittany! 🫶

🚨 CHECK ON YOUR WAVY HAIRED FRIENDS! 🚨 The rest of the world might LOVE the lack of humidity in the air - but alot of us are struggling rn!!! 😭

🧐 WHY? 🧐 
We thrive in high moisture climates! Damp rainforests, river hair, beach hair, slightly caught in the rain hair ➡️ there’s a common denominator for why wavy hair looks AWESOME in these situations! WATER 💦 is our friend, y’all!

The moisture and humidity in the summer enhances our curl pattern and boosts volume 🌞 🌀 📈 When winter rolls around, my curl pattern drops out thus presenting more straight and less wavy. I lose volume and can get reallyyy frustrated with my hair! 

WHAT CAN YOU DO? 🥶🥶🥶
• lose some length! Take a few inches off so you can also go shorter with your layers ✂️
• switch up your products. I typically go from using Hair Balm by @hairstorystudio in the summer to @cultandking Jelly in the winter. (More hold & more salt to enhance my texture)
• switch to New Wash!!!! 🗣️🗣️🗣️ new wash keeps my hair MUCH more hydrated than any typical sudsy shampoo. With that I’m able to achieve better curls and way less static! 🙌
